title.narrative: MERAP - Middle East Regional Agri. Prog.

description.narrative: The objective of the regional agricultural programme is to promote peace and mutual trust among the partners and to strengthen the technical cooperation in order to improve agricultural productivity and profitability through mutual sharing of knowledge and technology. The current partners are Israel, Jordan, the Palestinian Authority and Denmark. The Programme includes the following four components: 1) improved productivity and profitability for local sheep and goat farmers and support to establishing sustainable fish farming, 2) improved watershed management, promotion of modern dry-land farming techniques and use of saline and treated waste water for irrigation, 3) improved horticulture production with emphasis on better and cleaner products and on improved post-harvest treatment, 4) improved extension service through better technical training of extension agents and support to farmers organisations. Cross-cutting aspects include improved environmental concerns and promotion of international production standards such as GGAP, HCCAP and organic certification. Egypt participated in the first two phases of the programme (1999 - 2010). For political reasons Egypt has not been able to participate in this last phase.
